abstract.t: When IKEv2 is used for remote VPN access (client to VPN gateway), thegateway assigns the client an IP address from the internal networkusing IKEv2 configuration payloads. The configuration payloadsspecified in RFC 4306 work well for IPv4, but make it difficult touse certain features of IPv6. This document describes thelimitations of current IKEv2 configuration payloads for IPv6, andexplores possible solutions that would allow IKEv2 to set up full-featured virtual IPv6 interfaces.
